message.content:
cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.CL, cs.CV, cs.AI

This paper deals with a machine learning problem of extreme multi-label classification (XMLC) and proposes a new approach called probabilistic label trees (PLTs) for tackling this problem. The paper discusses the comparison of PLTs with hierarchical softmax (HSM) and XML-CNN, which are commonly used approaches for multi-class and XMLC problems, respectively. Therefore, the paper is likely to belong to the following arXiv CS sub-categories:

- cs.LG (Machine Learning): This sub-category covers papers related to the development of machine learning algorithms and models, which is the main focus of this paper.
- cs.IR (Information Retrieval): This sub-category deals with the retrieval of information from large collections of data, which is relevant to the problem of XMLC addressed in this paper.
- cs.CL (Computation and Language): This sub-category covers papers related to natural language processing and computational linguistics, which can be relevant to the text-based XMLC problems that the proposed approach is designed for.
- cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition): This sub-category covers papers related to computer vision and image processing, which can be relevant to the image-based XMLC problems that the proposed approach can be applied to.
- cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence): This sub-category covers papers related to various aspects of artificial intelligence, including machine learning, natural language processing, and computer vision, which are all relevant
